epfl.lsr.bachelor.project.server.request

Class Request

  • java.lang.Object
    • epfl.lsr.bachelor.project.server.request.Request
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AppendRequest, DecrRequest, DelRequest, ErrRequest, GetRequest, IncrRequest, PingRequest, SetRequest

    public abstract class Request
extends java.lang.Object
    Represent a request received from the client
    Author:
    Gregory Maitre & Patrick Andrade

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      Request(java.lang.String key)
      Default constructor
      Request(java.lang.String key, Value<?> value)
      Constructor to simplify the construction of a SetRequest

    • Method Detail

      • perform

        public abstract void perform()
                      throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Call to perform the request. When we finish to peform the request, we must notify() the thread that wait for this monitor!
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException

      • respond

             throws java.io.IOException
        Enables to give an answer back after performing a request

        Enables to know if the request can be performed
        Returns:

        messageToReturn - the message to be returned

      • notifyRequestPerformed

        public void notifyRequestPerformed(Request request)
        Enables to notify the thread in waiting-mode that the request has been performed. This must be called after performing the request

      • isMessageEmpty

        public boolean isMessageEmpty()
        Enables to know if the the message to be returned after performing the request is empty
        Returns:
        is the message empty or not
